title: The root schema
description: The root schema comprises the entire JSON document.

message-id.title: The message-id schema
message-id.description: This is used to uniquely identify devices.

json-web-token.title: The json-web-token schema
json-web-token.description: This is used to authenticate users.

aws-user-name.title: The aws-user-name schema
aws-user-name.description: The Cognito username for the person who is making the request.

role-list.title: The role-list schema
role-list.description: This determines which actions user can perform.

anyOf.title: The first anyOf schema
anyOf.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

organizations-id.title: The organizations-id schema
organizations-id.description: This is a system generated id that is used to restrict access to customers data.

notes-type.title: The notes-type schema
notes-type.description: This is a system generated id(s) that is used to restrict access to micro-service data. This is the source table primary key field value

anyOf.title: The first anyOf schema
anyOf.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

notes-owner-key.title: The notes-owner-key schema
notes-owner-key.description: This is a system generated id(s) that is used to restrict access to micro-service data. This is the source table primary key field value

anyOf.title: The first anyOf schema
anyOf.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

sort-order.title: The sort-order schema
sort-order.description: This is the sequence list items will be returned.

notes-owner-key.title: The notes-owner-key schema
notes-owner-key.description: List will be sorted in ascending order of notes-owner-key.

record-limit-count.title: The record-limit-count schema
record-limit-count.description: This is the number of records that will be returned.

record-offset.title: The record-offset schema
record-offset.description: This determines number of rows to skip  before returning records.
